Southern rock heroes The Black Crowes carried   their classic sound to the picturesque town of Oxford, Mississippi for a special performance at a former silent movie house in the "Little Easy." Built in 1913, The Lyric Theatre provided a historic setting for the band's first Artists Den appearance, a rollicking concert featuring both fan favorites and songs from their last album, Before the Frost...


Episode taped on September 2009 , features the Black Crowes performing 10 songs; there are also several interview segments with Chris.

Discerning music lovers who admire the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s deep catalog will appreciate the range of material offered up over the course of 60 minutes. 

Things close out with the band roaring through the retro rock Ã¢â‚¬ËœnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ roll of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Thick nÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Thin.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ There are few modern-day bands that jam with the kind of raucous and rollicking abandon of the Crowes without losing control and falling off the rails. 

If you are a fan of the Black Crowes Ã¢â‚¬â€œ or rock Ã¢â‚¬ËœnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ roll that celebrates the past and present Ã¢â‚¬â€œ make sure to catch this  great hour of music, courtesy of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Live from the Artists DenÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
